item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "There is no power relation without the correlative constitution of a field of knowledge, nor any knowledge that does not presuppose and constitute at the same time power relations" -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Knowledge is not for knowing: knowledge is for cutting." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Shantideva
item.description: "For as long as space endures And for as long as living beings remain, Until then may I too abide To dispel the misery of the world." -- Shantideva

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "Lovers alone wear sunlight." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "For whatever we lose (like a you or a me), It's always our self we find in the sea." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "since the thing perhaps is to eat flowers and not to be afraid" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "You know quite well, deep within you, that there is only a single magic, a single power, a single salvation...and that is called loving. Well, then, love your suffering. Do not resist it, do not flee from it. It is your aversion that hurts, nothing else. " -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Hatred, which could destroy so much, never failed to destroy the man who hated, and this was an immutable law." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "If the concept of God has any validity or any use, it can only be to make us larger, freer, and more loving. If God cannot do this, then it is time we got rid of Him." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Do I really want to be integrated into a burning house?" -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "There is no reason for you to try to become like white people and there is no basis whatever for their impertinent assumption that *they* must accept *you*. The really terrible thing, old buddy, is that you must accept them. And I mean that very seriously. You must accept them and accept them with love." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James A. Baldwin
item.description: "Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up." -- James A. Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "People pay for what they do, and still more for what they have allowed themselves to become. And they pay for it very simply; by the lives they lead." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Anyone who has ever struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Perhaps the whole root of our trouble, the human trouble, is that we will sacrifice all the beauty of our lives, will imprison ourselves in totems, taboos, crosses, blood sacrifices, steeples, mosques, races, armies, flags, nations, in order to deny the fact of death, the only fact we have. It seems to me that one ought to rejoice in the fact of death--ought to decide, indeed, to earn one's death by confronting with passion the conundrum of life." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "It is very nearly impossible to become an educated person in a country so distrustful of the independent mind." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Nothing is more desirable than to be released from an affliction, but nothing is more frightening than to be divested of a crutch. " -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Nakedness has no color: this can come as news only to those who have never covered, or been covered by, another naked human being." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description: "It's never the changes we want that change everything." -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "But if these years have taught me anything it is this: you can never run away. Not ever. The only way out is in." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "The half-life of love is forever." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Marion Woodman
item.description: "Love is the real power. It's the energy that cherishes. The more you work with that energy, the more you will see how people respond naturally to it, and the more you will want to use it. It brings out your creativity, and helps everyone around you flower. Your children, the people you work with--everyone blooms." -- Marion Woodman

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "Nobody’s going to save you. No one’s going to cut you down, cut the thorns thick around you. No one’s going to storm the castle walls nor kiss awake your birth, climb down your hair, nor mount you onto the white steed. There is no one who will feed the yearning. Face it. You will have to do, do it yourself." -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by M. Scott Peck
item.description: "Life is difficult. This is a great truth, one of the greatest truths. It is a great truth because once we truly see this truth, we transcend it. Once we truly know that life is difficult-once we truly understand and accept it-then life is no longer difficult. Because once it is accepted, the fact that life is difficult no longer matters." -- M. Scott Peck
